The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its roots are anchored in the mud at the bottom of the water body, while the stems are adapted for buoyancy. Ecastaphyllum hygrophilum plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
